title: High CPU usage every minute when subscribed to inaccessible feed
content:
I am using TB 140.4.0esr (64-bit) on Kubuntu 24.04.

Noticed with `top` utility that there is 40-50% CPU usage by thunderbird process. Spike starts every minute and continues for about 30 seconds.

Turns out, if you are using Blogs and News Feeds feature (RSS), TB tries to update some feed every minute. And if feed is inaccessible, I guess, it tries to do so for ~30 secods, then timeouts.

I subscribed to some blogs years ago. Now couple of them disappeared unfortunately.

When I paused updated for certain feeds, CPU spikes has gone.

Hope this can help someone.
creator: Emerald
